algorithmSettings.name: number_of_samples
algorithmSettings.description: Positive integer (this discretizes a continous variable)

algorithmSettings.name: seed
algorithmSettings.description: Integer seed for random number generator

algorithmSettings.name: failed_f_value
algorithmSettings.description: Return Value for F(x) if F fails

arguments.name: weather_file_name
arguments.description: Name of the weather file to change to. This is the filename with the extension (e.g. NewWeather.epw). Optionally this can inclucde the full file path, but for most use cases should just be file name.

arguments.name: set_year
arguments.description: This will impact the day of the week the simulation starts on. An input value of 0 will leave the year un-altered

arguments.name: use_upstream_args
arguments.description: When true this will look for arguments or registerValues in upstream measures that match arguments from this measure, and will use the value from the upstream measure in place of what is entered for this measure.

arguments.name: epw_gsub
arguments.display_name: Find and replace option from existing weather file name.
arguments.description: This will override what is entered in weather file name or from upstream measures, unless Do Nothing is selected.

measures.name: create_typical_building_from_model
measures.description: Takes a model with space and stub space types, and assigns constructions, schedules, internal loads, hvac, and other loads such as exterior lights and service water heating.
measures.modeler_description: It is important that the template argument chosen for this measure is in line with the buding types for the stub space types of the model passed in.

arguments.name: hvac_delivery_type
arguments.description: How the HVAC system delivers heating or cooling to the zone.

arguments.name: htg_src
arguments.description: The primary source of heating used by HVAC systems in the model.

arguments.name: clg_src
arguments.description: The primary source of cooling used by HVAC systems in the model.

arguments.name: swh_src
arguments.description: The primary source of heating used by SWH systems in the model.

arguments.name: kitchen_makeup
arguments.display_name: Kitchen Exhaust MakeUp Air Calculation Method
arguments.description: Determine logic to identify dining or cafe zones to provide makeup air to kitchen exhaust.

arguments.name: exterior_lighting_zone
arguments.description: Identify the Exterior Lighting Zone for the Building Site.

arguments.name: add_constructions
arguments.description: Construction Set will be applied to entire building

arguments.name: add_space_type_loads
arguments.display_name: Add Space Type Loads to Model
arguments.description: Populate existing space types in model with internal loads.

arguments.name: add_elevators
arguments.description: Elevators will be add directly to space in model vs. being applied to a space type.

arguments.name: add_internal_mass
arguments.description: Adds internal mass to each space.

arguments.name: add_exterior_lights
arguments.description: Multiple exterior lights objects will be added for different classes of lighting such as parking and facade.

arguments.name: onsite_parking_fraction
arguments.description: If set to 0 no exterior lighting for parking will be added

arguments.name: add_exhaust
arguments.description: Depending upon building type exhaust fans can be in kitchens, restrooms or other space types

arguments.name: add_swh
arguments.display_name: Add Service Water Heating to Model
arguments.description: This will add both the supply and demand side of service water heating.

arguments.name: add_thermostat
arguments.description: Add Thermostat to model based on Space Type Standards information of spaces assigned to thermal zones.

arguments.name: add_hvac
arguments.description: Add HVAC System to the model

arguments.name: add_refrigeration
arguments.description: Add refrigeration cases and walkins model

arguments.name: modify_wkdy_op_hrs
arguments.description: Modify the weekday hours of operation in the model.

arguments.name: wkdy_op_hrs_start_time
arguments.description: Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm. Only used if Modify weekday hours of operation is true.

arguments.name: wkdy_op_hrs_duration
arguments.description: Length of weekday operating hours. Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm. Only used if Modify weekday hours of operation is true.

arguments.name: modify_wknd_op_hrs
arguments.description: Modify the weekend hours of operation in the model.

arguments.name: wknd_op_hrs_start_time
arguments.description: Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm.  Only used if Modify weekend hours of operation is true.

arguments.name: wknd_op_hrs_duration
arguments.description: Length of weekend operating hours. Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm.  Only used if Modify weekend hours of operation is true.

arguments.name: unmet_hours_tolerance
arguments.description: Set the thermostat setpoint tolerance for unmet hours in degrees Rankine

arguments.name: remove_objects
arguments.description: Only removes objects of type that are selected to be added.

arguments.name: use_upstream_args
arguments.description: When true this will look for arguments or registerValues in upstream measures that match arguments from this measure, and will use the value from the upstream measure in place of what is entered for this measure.

arguments.name: enable_dst
arguments.description: By default this will force daylight savings to be enabled. Set to false if in a location where DST is not followed, or if needed for specific use case.

measures.name: create_bar_from_building_type_ratios
measures.display_name: Create Bar From Building Type Ratios
measures.description: Creates one or more rectangular building elements based on space type ratios of selected mix of building types, along with user arguments that describe the desired geometry characteristics.
measures.modeler_description: The building floor area can be described as a footprint size or as a total building area. The shape can be described by its aspect ratio or can be defined as a set width. Because this measure contains both DOE and DEER inputs, care needs to be taken to choose a template compatable with the selected building types. See readme document for additional guidance.

arguments.name: bldg_type_a_num_units
arguments.display_name: Primary Building Type Number of Units
arguments.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

arguments.name: bldg_type_b_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type B Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_b_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type B Number of Units
arguments.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

arguments.name: bldg_type_c_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type C Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_c_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type C Number of Units
arguments.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

arguments.name: bldg_type_d_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type D Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_d_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type D Number of Units
arguments.description: Number of units argument not currently used by this measure

arguments.name: single_floor_area
arguments.description: Non-zero value will fix the single floor area, overriding a user entry for Total Building Floor Area

arguments.name: floor_height
arguments.description: Selecting a typical floor height of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

arguments.name: custom_height_bar
arguments.description: This is argument value is only relevant when smart default floor to floor height is used for a building type that has spaces with custom heights.

arguments.name: building_rotation
arguments.description: Set Building Rotation off of North (positive value is clockwise). Rotation applied after geometry generation. Values greater than +/- 45 will result in aspect ratio and party wall orientations that do not match cardinal directions of the inputs.

arguments.name: ns_to_ew_ratio
arguments.display_name: Ratio of North/South Facade Length Relative to East/West Facade Length
arguments.description: Selecting an aspect ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. Aspect ratios less than one are not recommended for sliced bar geometry, instead rotate building and use a greater than 1 aspect ratio.

arguments.name: perim_mult
arguments.description: Selecting a value of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. This represents a multiplier for the building perimeter relative to the perimeter of a rectangular building that meets the area and aspect ratio inputs. Other than the smart default of 0.0 this argument should have a value of 1.0 or higher and is only applicable Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced division method.

arguments.name: bar_width
arguments.description: Non-zero value will fix the building width, overriding user entry for Perimeter Multiplier. NS/EW Aspect Ratio may be limited based on target width.

arguments.name: bar_sep_dist_mult
arguments.description: Multiplier of separation between bar elements relative to building height.

arguments.name: wwr
arguments.description: Selecting a window to wall ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

arguments.name: party_wall_fraction
arguments.display_name: Fraction of Exterior Wall Area with Adjacent Structure
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition.

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_north
arguments.display_name: Number of North facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior north walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_south
arguments.display_name: Number of South facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior south walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_east
arguments.display_name: Number of East facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior east walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_west
arguments.display_name: Number of West facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior west walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: bottom_story_ground_exposed_floor
arguments.display_name: Is the Bottom Story Exposed to Ground
arguments.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the lowest story. The bottom story floor will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

arguments.name: top_story_exterior_exposed_roof
arguments.display_name: Is the Top Story an Exterior Roof
arguments.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the highest story. The top story ceiling will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

arguments.name: make_mid_story_surfaces_adiabatic
arguments.display_name: Make Mid Story Floor Surfaces Adiabatic
arguments.description: If set to true, this will skip surface intersection and make mid story floors and celings adiabatic, not just at multiplied gaps.

arguments.name: bar_division_method
arguments.display_name: Division Method for Bar Space Types
arguments.description: To use perimeter multiplier greater than 1 selected Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced.
arguments.default_value: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
choice_values: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter
choice_display_names: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter

choiceDisplayNames: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter
inputs.maximum: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
inputs.minimum: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
inputs.mean: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
inputs.deltaX: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
inputs.stdDev: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
inputs.default_value: Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter

arguments.name: double_loaded_corridor
arguments.description: Add double loaded corridor for building types that have a defined circulation space type, to the selected space types.

arguments.name: use_upstream_args
arguments.description: When true this will look for arguments or registerValues in upstream measures that match arguments from this measure, and will use the value from the upstream measure in place of what is entered for this measure.

arguments.name: climate_zone
arguments.description: Climate Zone argument is not used by this measure

measures.name: add_thermochromic_bipv
measures.description: Adds BIPV (Building Integrated Photovoltaic) on window surfaces. Define switching temperature for thermochromic windows. Implement power conversion efficiency difference between light and dark state windows.
measures.modeler_description: Adds simple PV object for BIPV implementation. Implement thermochromic window with switching temperature definition. Implement power conversion efficiency difference betwee light and dark state windows.

arguments.name: dot_coverage
arguments.display_name: Active portion of PV from window surface area

arguments.name: pce_scenario
arguments.display_name: Choice of power conversion efficiency modeling scenario

arguments.name: pv_eff_light
arguments.display_name: PV power conversion efficiency in light state

arguments.name: pv_eff_dark
arguments.display_name: PV power conversion efficiency in dark state

arguments.name: switch_t
arguments.display_name: State switching temperature for thermochromic window

arguments.name: debug_mode
arguments.description: Print debugging info

measures.name: add_output_variable
measures.description: This measure adds an output variable at the requested reporting frequency.
measures.modeler_description: The measure just passes in the string and does not validate that it is a proper variable name. It is up to the user to know this or to look at the .rdd file from a previous simulation run.

inputs.default_value: Surface Window Thermochromic Layer Property Specification Temperature

arguments.name: key_value
arguments.description: Enter * for all objects or the full name of a specific object to.

measures.name: add_output_variable_2
measures.description: This measure adds an output variable at the requested reporting frequency.
measures.modeler_description: The measure just passes in the string and does not validate that it is a proper variable name. It is up to the user to know this or to look at the .rdd file from a previous simulation run.

arguments.name: key_value
arguments.description: Enter * for all objects or the full name of a specific object to.

measures.name: add_output_variable_2_2
measures.description: This measure adds an output variable at the requested reporting frequency.
measures.modeler_description: The measure just passes in the string and does not validate that it is a proper variable name. It is up to the user to know this or to look at the .rdd file from a previous simulation run.

arguments.name: key_value
arguments.description: Enter * for all objects or the full name of a specific object to.

measures.name: add_output_variable_2_2_2
measures.description: This measure adds an output variable at the requested reporting frequency.
measures.modeler_description: The measure just passes in the string and does not validate that it is a proper variable name. It is up to the user to know this or to look at the .rdd file from a previous simulation run.

arguments.name: key_value
arguments.description: Enter * for all objects or the full name of a specific object to.

measures.name: add_output_variable_2_2_2_2
measures.description: This measure adds an output variable at the requested reporting frequency.
measures.modeler_description: The measure just passes in the string and does not validate that it is a proper variable name. It is up to the user to know this or to look at the .rdd file from a previous simulation run.

arguments.name: key_value
arguments.description: Enter * for all objects or the full name of a specific object to.

measures.name: a_inject_window_specific_idf_objects
measures.description: This measure allows you to inject IDF objects into an OSM generated IDF prior to passing the IDF off to EnergyPlus.
measures.modeler_description:
This provides a stepping stone between exporting an IDF from OpenStudio and hand editing the IDF and writing fully functional OpenStudio EnergyPlus measures.

This measure works for when you just need to add new IDF objects. If you need to interact with or alter IDF objects made by the OpenStudio forward translator, you will want to write an EnergyPlus measure wtih more use-case specific logic.

arguments.name: idf_path
arguments.display_name: path to the folder that includes idf files containing window objects

arguments.name: t_switching
arguments.display_name: Switching temperature of a thermochromic window
arguments.description: Only applicable when thermochromic window is selected

arguments.name: serverrun
arguments.display_name: Running on the server (and not in local)?
arguments.description: Select if simulation is being ran on the server
